hanzi-su-wiki:
憲

Значения

Закон; конституция

Мнемоника

Сердце 心 надо беречь от сглаза 害. В широком смысле — жандарм, конституция, закон (охраняют).

Варианты

宪

xiàn
statute; constitution
статут; конституция

heisig_chinese_memo: In the house where I grew up under the watchful eye of my mother, we had to study the constitution until we knew it by heart.
heisig_constituent: constitution, mansion, house, grow up, eye, cross-eyed, net, heart
heisig_story: The key word refers to the fundamental guiding principles of a government or other organization. Its elements: House . . . grow up . . . eyes . . . heart.
koohiiStory1: The constitution is important. At least my parents thought so. In the house where I grew up, it was framed on the wall. Under the watchful (sideways) eye of my mother, we had to study it until we knew it by heart.
koohiiStory2: The constitution states the following rights: You may live in your own house and grow up. And you will never be watched by big brother's eye so they cannot control your heart (your believes).
WaniKani_Radicals: 宀, 生, 罒, 心
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The roof protecting your life and the net protecting your heart are both protected by the constitution.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: The constitution makes it so that everything you hold dear is locked away, nice and safe on a piece of paper, and no one can change the rules or hurt you without your say so.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Your country's constitution is being protected by none other than Ken (けん) the samurai, hero for hire.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture Ken standing in front of your constitution. But keep a close watch, cause wily ol' Nic Cage is in the business of thievin' on constitutions.
Ru_Radicals: 亠 (крышка), 土 (земля), 宀 (значок У), 心 (сердце), 買 (покупать)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the heart (心) in the net (罒) and the master (龶) under the roof (宀) are protected by the constitution
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Before the constitution was read by those who wanted to, but in the new USA it's mandatory that it's read in every house.  Things are really going downhill.
humanum_full_description_en:
Different opinions on the initial meaning of the word " constitution " are different. Token of Kato believes that elephants wear a hat on their head to cover their eyes. The original meaning is something that covers the head, that is, a hat. Zhang Shichao and others believe that the original meaning of " constitution " is to see clearly and to be able to observe, but the original meaning of " sage " is to be good at hearing. One talk about Chu Wen (Xu Zaiguo ) suspected to be " blind ."

Bronze inscription is used as a person's name, and it also means wise and wise. The history wall plate: "𡩜 (constitution) Shengcheng King", which means the wise and wise King Zhou Cheng (see the general explanation of the form and meaning of the inscription).

"Shuowen": "Xian, Min Ye. From the heart to the eye, to save the sound."
humanum_short_description_en: From the Early Bronze ◎, down from the " head ", scholars believe ◎ to " harm " the province, plus the heads from the late " heart ", " 𡩜 " sound, original meaning of unknown configuration.
humanum_full_description:
「憲」字構形初義各家意見不一。加藤常賢認為象頭上戴着帽子，掩蓋眼睛之形，本義為覆蓋頭之物，即帽子。張世超等則認為「憲」本義是目明善察，猶「聖」本義是耳聰善聽。一說疑為「瞎」的初文(徐在國)。

　　金文用作人名，又表示賢明睿智，史牆盤：「𡩜(憲)聖成王」，表示賢明的周成王(參金文形義通解)。

　　《說文》：「憲，敏也。从心从目，害省聲。」
humanum_short_description: 早期金文上從◎，下從「目」，學者多認為◎為「害」省，後期在目下加從「心」，「𡩜」聲，構形初義不明。

憲法(けんぽう): constitution

「 憲 」字構形初義各家意見不一。加藤常賢認為象頭上戴着帽子，掩蓋眼睛之形，本義為覆蓋頭之物，即帽子。張世超等則認為「 憲 」本義是目明善察，猶「 聖 」本義是耳聰善聽。一說疑為「 瞎 」的初文(徐在國)。 金文用作人名，又表示賢明睿智，史牆盤：「𡩜(憲)聖成王」，表示賢明的周成王(參金文形義通解)。 《說文》：「憲，敏也。从心从目，害省聲。」
Different opinions on the initial meaning of the word " constitution" are different. Token of Kato believes that elephants wear a hat on their head to cover their eyes. The original meaning is something that covers the head, that is, a hat. Zhang Shichao and others believe that the original meaning of " constitution" is to see clearly and to be able to observe, but the original meaning of " sage" is to be good at hearing. One talk about Chu Wen (Xu Zaiguo) suspected to be " blind." Bronze inscription is used as a person's name, and it also means wise and wise. The history wall plate: "𡩜 (constitution) Shengcheng King", which means the wise and wise King Zhou Cheng (see the general explanation of the form and meaning of the inscription). "Shuowen": "Xian, Min Ye. From the heart to the eye, to save the sound."

憲字的基本解释

憲
xiàn
见“宪”。

憲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiàn］
［《廣韻》許建切，去願，曉。］
“宪1”的繁体字。
(1)法令；法度。
(2)典范，榜样。
(3)历法。
(4)指推步，推算历数。
(5)宪法的省称。
(6)公布；揭示。
(7)效法。
(8)思虑。
(9)方法。
(10)弹劾。
(11)指司刑狱的中央、地方机构或官员。如唐代称刑部为宪部，宋代的提点刑狱司及提刑别称宪。
(12)旧指朝廷委驻各行省的高级官吏。如清代称巡抚、藩司、臬司为三大宪。引申为对上司的尊称。
(13)喜乐貌。参见“憲憲”。
(14)通“軒”。高起，抬起。
(15)姓。汉有宪义渠。见《急就篇》卷二。
[②]［xiǎn］
［《集韻》呼典切，上銑，曉。］
通“顯1”。
(1)明显。参见“憲2憲”。
(2)犹皇。旧时对先人的美称。参见“憲2考”。

憲字的康熙字典解释

【卯集上】【心字部】　憲； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页404第11
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?許建切，音獻。懸法示人曰憲。从害省，从心从目。觀於法象，使人曉然知不善之害。接於目，怵於心，凜乎不可犯也。【周禮·天官·小宰】憲禁于王宮。【註】憲謂表縣之，若今新有法令也。【詩·大雅】文武是憲。【箋】憲，表也，言爲文武之表式也。因憲爲表式之義，故人之取法，亦謂之憲。【書·說命】惟聖時憲。【傳】憲，法也，言聖王法天，以立敎於下也。【禮·內則】五帝憲。【註】法其德行也。　又【說文】敏也。【禮·學記】發慮憲。【註】言發計慮，當擬度於法式。【徐鍇曰】目與心應爲敏也。　又【諡法】博聞多記曰憲。　又【詩·大雅】無然憲憲。【毛傳】憲憲，猶欣欣也。【箋】女無憲憲然爲之制法度，達其意以成其惡也。蓋譏當時變亂舊章，創立新法。此憲憲二字，殆詼諧語，所以深刺之也。後人引訓憲字正文，以釋憲字，遂覺憲字爲表示人以惡者，其去憲字本義何啻萬里。大抵字書訓義，多犯此病，不得不辨。　又州名。本樓煩監，唐置州。　又姓。出【姓苑】。【集韻】或作䩵。　又【集韻】

憲字的源字形

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiàn］
["Guang Yun" Xu Jianqie, go to wish, Xiao. ]
Traditional characters of "宪1".
(1) Statutes; statutes.
(2) Model, role model.
(3) Calendar.
(4) Refers to pushing steps and calculating calendars.
(5) The name of the province in the constitution.
(6) Announce; reveal.
(7) Follow the example.
(8) Thoughts.
(9) Method.
(10) Impeachment.
(11) Refers to the central or local agencies or officials who are sentencing prisons. For example, in the Tang Dynasty, the Ministry of Punishment was called the Constitutional Ministry, and the Department of Punishment and Prisons in the Song Dynasty was also called Constitution.
(12) The old refers to the senior officials stationed by the imperial court in various provinces. For example, in the Qing Dynasty, the governor, vassal, and lieutenant were the three major constitutions. The extension is a respectful name for the boss.
(13) Joyful appearance. See "constitutional constitution".
(14) Through "Xuan". Lift up, lift up.
(15) Last name. There is a constitutional righteous channel in Han Dynasty. See Volume 2 of "Jijiu Pian".
[②]［xiǎn］
["Jiyun" Calling Dian cut, milling, Xiao. ]
Pass "Display 1".
(1) Obvious. See "constitution 2 constitution".
(2) The Jews. The old name for the ancestors. See "Constitution 2 Examination".
